body: Yep, I thought I had tested this... Will fix this asap
does it work when you add a slice validation in your array, like 'maxItems: 10000' ?
Nope. The size validation gets added to the method, but it still tries to loop through the array and call validate on the interface.
OK. I'll have a fix over the week end.

issue.title: No validation is called when the object referring to the array type parameter
issue.body:
## Problem statement
The issue is similar to the Issue #1392 and #1093 but not the same.
When the body parameter is an under properties in object type, referencing array data type, none of the validation is called. But if we mark the body parameter required, the validation will show in the auto-generated code.

## Swagger specification
**Case : 1**
```yaml
profileCfg: 
           type: object
           properties:
               value1:
                   type: integer
                   format: int32
              value2:
                  type: integer
                  format: int32                    
profileCfgs:
           type: array
           x-omitempty: true
           items:
              $ref: '#definitions/profileCfg'
Profile:
           type: object
           properties: 
                  profileCfg:
                       $ref: '#definitions/profileCfgs'
```

**Case: 2**
```yaml
profileCfg: 
           type: object
           properties:
               value1:
                   type: integer
                   format: int32
              value2:
                  type: integer
                  format: int32                    
profileCfgs:
           type: array
           x-omitempty: true
           items:
              $ref: '#definitions/profileCfg'
Profile:
           type: object
           required:
               - profileCfg
           properties: 
                  profileCfg:
                       $ref: '#definitions/profileCfgs'
```

**Case 3**

```yaml
profileCfg: 
           type: object
           properties:
               value1:
                   type: integer
                   format: int32
              value2:
                  type: integer
                  format: int32            
Profile:
           type: object
           required:
               - profileCfg
           properties: 
                  profileCfg:
                       type: array
                       x-omitempty: true
                       items:
                         $ref: '#definitions/profileCfg'
```
                    
## Steps to reproduce

Generate the server based on this swagger
In the Case1, the validation will not be generated.

```go
func (m *Profile) Validate(formats strfmt.Registry) error {
        var res []error
        if len(res) > 0 {
                              return errors
        }
         return nil
}
```

In the Case2, the validation will be generated successfully.

```go
func (m *profile) Validate(formats strfmt.Registry) error {
      var res []error
      if err := m.validateProfile(formats); err != nil {
                res = append(res, err)
      }
     if len(res) > 0 {
                              return errors
        }
         return nil
}
```

In the Case3, if we remove the refer to the array struct, and without mark the area required the validation will still be generated same as the code in the Case 2. (Case 3 validation generation is by the fix in the issue #1392 and #1093.

So I think there may an issue that I have to mark the parameter required which it referring to the array struct if I want the validation to generate. Thanks very much for your help!

## Environment
swagger version: 0.13.0
go version: go1.10.2 linux/amd64
OS:  Linux Centos

body:
ok fixed it in dev without visible regression. Now the tedious process of adding more UT for codegen...
I'll do that tomorow.

issue.title: Body validations
issue.body:
* Fixes #1536 (body array of empty objects)

Model validations

* Fixes #1537 (property is non required aliased array)

Caution/todos:
* [] Do not work yet as anonymous extra schemas (i.e. with --skip-flatten)
* [] Similar problem with maps (e.g. body of object with additional properties to validate)

issue.title: Rendering and validation of maps in body
issue.body:
## Problem statement

Following investigations about #1536 (body param is an array), it appeared that the situation 
in which body is a map is not rendered properly, and neither is validation carried on.

Situations such as:
```yaml
parameters:
  - name: mapOfObject
     in: body
     required: true
     schema:
      type: object
      additionalProperties:
        $ref: '#/definitions/modelObject'
```

are rendered as interface{} param without validation.

I am proposing a PR to produce a mapping like this:
```go
type GetMapObjectParams struct {
  ...
  MapOfObject models.GetMapObjectParamBody
```

and the corresponding validation, calling `body.Validate(route.Formats)`

This is for maps of complex objects.

For simple maps such as in:
```yaml
parameters:
  - name: mapOfArrayWithMax
     in: body
     required: true
     schema:
      type: object
      additionalProperties:
        $ref: '#/definitions/modelArray'
```

```yaml
parameters:
  - name: mapOfAnonArray
     in: body
     required: true
     schema:
      type: object
      additionalProperties:
        type: array
        maxItems: 10
        items:
          type: integer
          maximum: 100
```

The rendering would respectively look like:
```go
   ...
  MapOfArrayWithMax map[string]models.ModelArrayWithMax
```
and
```go
   ...
  MapOfAnonArray map[string][]int64
```
In these cases, validation is deferred to a method called by `BindRequest` to take care of nested structures.

Also, when using aliased interface{} types, such as in : 
```yaml
parameters:
  - name: mapOfInterface
     in: body
     required: true
     schema:
      type: object
      additionalProperties:
        $ref: '#/definitions/modelInterface'
```

The rendering would not be just `interface{}`, but rather:

```go
  ...
  MapOfInterface map[string]models.ModelInterface
``` 

Of course in this case, there is no validation.

Since I discovered other problems when using `--skip-flatten`,  i.e. full support for body validation with anonymous schemas generated in the operation package, I'd rather defer the resolution of 
issues specific to having everything anonymous (with possible duplicates) to another PR.

## Swagger specification
See example above.

## Steps to reproduce
`generate server ...`

## Environment
swagger version: 0.14 
go version: 1.9.1
OS:   ubuntu 14

issue.title: Render and validate maps in body parameters
issue.body:
## Render and validate maps in body parameters
- fix incorrect rendering of maps in body param (i.e systematic `nterface{}` type)
- validate maps (e.g. schema AdditionalProperties) in body parameter
- render simple maps (e.g. `map[string][]map[string][][][]int64`) as inlined types
- maps of schema does not create a schema of their own, just the complex part (e.g. `map[string][][]map[string]model.MyModel`)

### Fixes

- fixes #1556 
- fixes #1562

### Summary of changes

- `operation.go`:**refactoring + new feature/fix**
  - refactored body param processing
  - treat anonymous maps as Child GenParameter structures (such as `[]map[string][][][]map[string]*model.MyMode`)
  - extended body param validation strategy selection to maps
  - fix: enums are considered slice validations, including for bod params
  
- `model.go`: **targeted fixes**
  - refactored slice validations
  - fix missing lift validation case for maps
  - align nullable status for maps of primitives or arrays of primitives (#1562)
  
- `types.go`: **cosmetic**
  - more comments in code (e.g. special nullability rules)
  - outsource debug func
  
- `structs.go`: **enrichments**
  - removed unused and unassigned `BodyParam` struct
  - enriched GenParameters to support map constructs
  
- `templates/server/parameter.gotmpl`: **refactoring + new feature/fix**
   - extended body param section to support maps as well as maps, with or without validations
   - large refactoring of nested validations to merge slice and map validations
   - follow guards as in models (IsZero | Required)
   
### Known issues

Known existing issues not resolved here:

1. fully supporting `--skip-flatten` (e.g. anonymous types + extra schemas in the operation package)
2. undue definitions created by flatten on maps of objects (non blocking)
3. incorrect validations of Zero Values in slices and maps in some cases (e.g. skipping validation with IsZero())
4. depending on the future solution to replace/remove IsZero|Required for slice and map elements, the nullability re-alignment above 
may be easily modified and change nullable priorities
5. Nice to have: nested array validations with slice validations should execute slice validation before, not after validating all elements
